divs: sighting detailsi was out casually looking at the stars the night of 5\11\09 because it was an exceptionally clear night and i could see quite of few stars. the big dipper was straight above and that is when i noticed what i thought was a satellite going accross the sky in nearly an east to west direction. (satellites are normally hard to see at my location because of light pollution.) no sooner did i thought "cool, there's a satellite", i saw another trailing it. as soon as the first one went out of sight, another one appeared in nearly the same trajectory. then it happened again and again for about 6 or 7 times. i thought, "whoa, this is weird". i called a friend (that's when i looked at the time) and told him what i saw, but i didn't see anything after that event. it's hard to describe the separation distance between the objects, but for comparison sake i would estimate it to be about the distance of the bucket opening of the big dipper i know that this isn't the way satellites are supposed to orbit, but i don't know what else the objects could be. the speed of the objects were going at the customarily speed of satellites i'm used to seeing. i didn't think they could be shooting stars because they weren't the right light intensity, speed, and they didn't leave a tail. there was no blinking lights, and they appeared to be quite high in the sky, so i don't think they could have been planes. after describing my story to a few friends, i was informed of some other ufo events in our area. i read about them, but what those stories desribed is not what i saw. i was hoping someone had a similar sighting. sorry, no photos. i don't know if that was even possible unless i had high quality equipment.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Arnold
There were no other sightings in Arnold on or around May 11th 2009
